title: Electronics 101: Learn Electronics as a Beginner & Expand Your Knowledge

steps.title: Read books to learn the fundamentals of electronics.
steps.content: Read books to learn the fundamentals of electronics. Visit your local library or a bookstore to begin reading about electronics. Even older books have a lot of information about electrical circuits and how they work. Use it to study the basics before you start building your own circuits. [1] X Research source Try books like Make: Electronics , The Art Of Electronics , or Foundations of Analog and Digital Electronic Circuits . Interested in becoming an electrician? Kuhlman recommends choosing an area to focus on (residential, commercial, or industrial) and then checking out the individual specialties within each area. [2] X Expert Source Jesse Kuhlman Master Electrician, Kuhlman Electric Expert Interview. 29 April 2020.

steps.title: Download phone and computer applications to study electrical engineering.
steps.content: Download phone and computer applications to study electrical engineering. Search your phone’s Play Store to find several informative, hands-on apps. Some apps teach you the basics of electronics, while others let you design your own circuit board using a touchscreen. For example, you can try Electronics Basics or ElectroDroid. EveryCircuit allows you to design and simulate circuits. You can download the mobile app or access the online app via a web browser on your computer. When you are ready for something more advanced, KiCad is free software you can download to design circuit boards professionally, printed circuit boards, and schematics.

steps.title: Study how a current travels through a circuit.
steps.content: Study how a current travels through a circuit. An electrical current consists of electrons, the negatively charged particles in atoms. In a current, the electrons flow from a negative source, such as a battery terminal. Then, they flow through a conductor, such as a wire, and return to the positive terminal. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Learn how to control the flow of current through a circuit.
steps.content: Learn how to control the flow of current through a circuit. Four main concepts determine how current flows through a circuit. They are voltage, amperage, resistance, and wattage. Voltage: Voltage measures the force needed to make a current flow through a circuit. In a circuit, the electrons accumulate near the battery’s negative terminal. Energy is required to get the current to flow through the circuit, and this measurement is the voltage. Amperage: Amperage is the rate at which electricity flows through a circuit. The higher the amperage (or amps), the more electrons can flow through the circuit. "The best way to think of [voltage and amperage]," says Kuhlman, is to think of a water hose. The voltage is the water pressure, and the amperage is the size of the hose. The larger the hose, the more amperage could be there. [4] X Expert Source Jesse Kuhlman Master Electrician, Kuhlman Electric Expert Interview. 29 April 2020. Resistance: As current flows through a circuit, different electric components and even wires add resistance to the current, slowing it down. Going with Kuhlman's water hose analogy, resistance would be like kinking the hose or adding a nozzle that restricts the water flow. Resistance is measured in Ohms (Ω). Wattage: Wattage (watts) is the total amount of electricity a device consumes. Different electronic devices consume different amounts of electricity. A light bulb can consume between 40 to 100 watts. A vacuum cleaner can consume between 400 to 900 watts. You can find out how much wattage a device consumes by multiplying the voltage by the amperage.

steps.title: Read circuit diagrams to understand the notation.
steps.content: Read circuit diagrams to understand the notation. Electrical diagrams and schematics use symbols to denote components. Before you can copy one to build your circuit, find out what the symbols mean. Search online for a list of symbols used as shorthand in diagrams. [5] X Research source The straight lines are wires. A battery is represented by a + sign followed by a long and short straight line. Diodes, for example, are represented by triangles. Resistors are represented by squares or jagged lines.

steps.title: Measure an electrical current with a multimeter.
steps.content: Measure an electrical current with a multimeter. A multimeter is a handy way to measure the different forces that make up an electrical charge. It’s helpful to have one on hand to test the current in any electrical circuit. Get one that measures the current, voltage, and resistance. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Add resistance to a current using a resistor.
steps.content: Add resistance to a current using a resistor. Resistors are small tubes on wires. They don’t actively do anything but are important in limiting the electrical current. Without a resistor, the electrical current can become too strong and ruin other components. [7] X Research source For example, attaching an LED to a circuit may burn out if the voltage is too strong. Adding a resistor before the LED can reduce the voltage flowing through the LED. You can usually identify how much resistance a resistor adds to the circuit by the color-coded bands or number code printed on the resistor.

steps.title: Store electricity with a capacitor.
steps.content: Store electricity with a capacitor. Capacitors are the opposite of resistors. Instead of limiting the flow, they encourage it by storing a little bit of electricity. This way, if the power is disrupted, the circuit continues to work. Using the water hose analogy again, a capacitor is like a water tank. When a water tank is full, water will continue to flow, even if you cut the water flow going into the tank, at least until the tank is empty. Capacitors can be used to temporarily store energy, smooth out voltage spikes and interruptions, as well as for timing. For example, if you unplug your computer, the capacitors will ensure the electrical current runs smoothly from the battery. Capacitors are often used in clocks and timers because the rate at which they charge and discharge is consistent time. [8] X Research source Capacitors come in a variety of sizes. The marking on the side of the capacitor indicates the voltage a capacitor can handle and the capacitance. Capacitance is measured in farads (F) or microfarads (μF). Warning: Capacitors can discharge electricity, causing electric shock. Always handle capacitors with care and never touch the metal terminals. Warning: If you apply more voltage than the capacitor can handle, the capacitor will explode.

steps.title: Control electrical currents using diodes and transistors.
steps.content: Control electrical currents using diodes and transistors. These components have + and - terminals that help conduct electricity. When activated, electricity flows through one end and out the other. Diodes have two ends, while transistors have three. Diodes are used to make an electrical current flow in one direction only. Diodes have a role to play in converting AC electricity into DC, extracting audio signals from radio waves, and converting sunlight into electricity in a solar panel. [9] X Research source Transistors are like switches that change the direction of a current. Transistors can be used to create logic gates, which compare multiple input signals to create a different output signal. This is the basis of modern computing. A modern computer CPU has millions or even billions of microscopic transistors. Transistors are also used in amplification. For example, in an FM radio, transistors can convert a weak radio signal into a signal strong enough to output to a speaker.

steps.title: Practice cutting and stripping wires.
steps.content: Practice cutting and stripping wires. For basic electrical work, you will need a wire cutter and a wire stripper from a hardware store. To do this, cut the wires to the length first. Then, strip about 1 ⁄ 4 in (0.64 cm) of insulation off the ends before connecting them to components. To work with the wire, hold the exposed ends against the components or tape them in place. If you use a breadboard, simply push the exposed end into the hole. When you first begin, you do not need to learn how to solder.

steps.title: Read about how wires of different colors are used.
steps.content: Read about how wires of different colors are used. Electrical wires are generally all copper. However, they are cased in different colors of plastic to distinguish their uses. Always connect like wires together. Use black and red wires to power your circuits. [10] X Research source Black wires are the main current conductors in a circuit. Red wires are secondary carriers. Blue and yellow wires are uncommon but are used to carry electricity in complex circuits. White and gray wires are considered neutral because they conduct unused electricity. Green wires are grounding wires which bring the current to the ground for safety.

steps.title: Build a circuit using a circuit diagram.
steps.content: Build a circuit using a circuit diagram. Search for circuit diagrams online to find a few simple ones you can attempt to build on your own. Read the diagram to figure out what components you need. Then, build the circuit so it looks like the diagram. It will help give you an idea of how a circuit works. [11] X Research source It is best to start with a smaller circuit. Pick one with few branching lines and available components like a battery and light bulb.

steps.title: Make a closed loop using a light bulb.
steps.content: Make a closed loop using a light bulb. Gather two copper wires, a fresh battery, and a light bulb. Set the components on a table, then hold the wires to connect the battery terminals to the bulb’s metal base until the light bulb lights up. [12] X Research source You can light the bulb with only these components. The electrical current flows from the negative terminal to the positive one, passing through the light bulb along the way. Seeing this closed loop make your light bulb come to life can give you a better understanding of how electricity moves in a circuit.

steps.title: Buy a kit for practice projects.
steps.content: Buy a kit for practice projects. Go online to find a variety of beginner kits for electronics. A wide variety of kits are available, each one packaged with the parts to complete a simple product. This is a good way to begin learning about electronics without building your own circuit board. For example, an educational rover is a small, pre-built robot. It is used to learn some basic customization and programming techniques.

steps.title: Practice working with Arduino boards.
steps.content: Practice working with Arduino boards. Arduino boards are inexpensive circuit boards used in most electronic projects. These are included in any kits you buy, but you can also purchase them separately online. They are beginner-friendly, so try using one to build some basic circuits and projects. Breadboards are blank circuit boards with a series of holes that you can put electronics components in. [13] X Research source A typical starter project is the “blinking light,” which teaches you how to make an LED light blink with some simple Arduino programming on your computer. If you don’t want to purchase a kit, you can start with an Arduino board and a USB cable. Connect the board to your computer and download the Arduino software online.

steps.title: Build circuits using a breadboard.
steps.content: Build circuits using a breadboard. A breadboard is a way to build a circuit without soldering. It looks like a piece of plastic with a bunch of holes in it. Push the wires and electronic components into the holes to connect them in a circuit. Connect the wires to an Arduino board or battery to create an electrical current. [14] X Trustworthy Source Science Buddies Expert-sourced database of science projects, explanations, and educational material Go to source Try activating an LED light using the breadboard. You will need wire, an LED, a resistor, and an Arduino board. You can order all these parts online.

steps.title: Make your own projects with online schematics.
steps.content: Make your own projects with online schematics. Once you are comfortable building circuits, come up with a few projects you would like to make, such as an alarm or sensor. Schematics are design diagrams that show you how to build a project. Many schematics can be found by searching online. For example, type “blinking light schematic” to find a few ways to build a circuit with a blinking LED light.

steps.title: Take a school course on electronics.
steps.content: Take a school course on electronics. No matter what age you are, you can find a class that will help you get started with electronics. Look online for introductory classes in electronics or electrical engineering. You may even find some in your area. Once you get started, you can move on to more advanced classes or practice making your own electrical circuits. Some high schools and colleges offer courses on these subjects. Also, look for free online courses on sites like Coursera or edX.

steps.title: Get a job working for a company that does electrical work.
steps.content: Get a job working for a company that does electrical work. According to Kuhlman, the best way to learn about the electrical field is to get a job in the area you want to work. "Think about what kind of setting you want to be in," he says. "Do you see yourself working in homes? Offices? What about big warehouses? Do you like working outside? Once you decide on a direction, find a company that does that kind of work and get started. [15] X Expert Source Jesse Kuhlman Master Electrician, Kuhlman Electric Expert Interview. 29 April 2020.

steps.title: Master a programming language to operate electronics.
steps.content: Master a programming language to operate electronics. Give your electronics directions by installing a microcontroller. This is a small computer chip that fits on your circuit board. Using one involves studying a computer programming language like C or C++, then typing out code through your computer. Arduino is a simple way to program microcontrollers for beginners. Plug the Arduino board into your computer, then download the Arduino software to begin coding. Raspberry Pi is another great way to learn how to program computers. Raspberry Pi are single-board computers that run Linux. You can use them to create a variety of computer-based electronics . [16] X Research source

steps.title: Design your own schematics using computer software.
steps.content: Design your own schematics using computer software. Download a simple, free design program like Fritzing on your computer. Use the program to put together your own custom electrical circuit. This helps you understand electrical circuits and schematics better. Also, you can use the program to design something unique to build. You can also use more complicated PCB design software like Eagle and KiCad. Once you have made a circuit, you can send it to a prototype manufacturer for printing.

steps.title: Take apart electrical appliances for studying.
steps.content: Take apart electrical appliances for studying. Deconstruct an old TV, toaster, or another device. Use it to study the electrical components inside. Then, try putting it back together again. You can also attempt to fix broken devices to get a better understanding of how the components work. [17] X Research source Take precautions to avoid electrical shock . Get permission before working on any devices you don't own.

steps.title: Practice soldering wires and electronics.
steps.content: Practice soldering wires and electronics . As you progress, you will eventually need to connect wires or fasten them to electrical boards. With a soldering iron, you can glue components together by heating tin soldering material. This helps you create better electrical circuits that last longer. [18] X Trustworthy Source Science Buddies Expert-sourced database of science projects, explanations, and educational material Go to source Breadboards are easy to use, but the connections fall out over time. Remember to take precautions when working with a hot iron and metal. Never leave the iron on or place it on a flammable surface.
